functions.name: can_process_refunds
functions.doc: Returns true if refunds can be processed (campaign ended, below min amount, and has escrowed donations)

functions.name: escrowed_donations_recipient_transfer_callback
functions.doc: Called after processing a batch of donations for a campaign, and transferring the total payout to the recipient

functions.name: ft_on_transfer
functions.doc: FT equivalent of donate, for use with FTs that implement NEP-144

functions.name: has_escrowed_donations_to_process
functions.doc: Returns true if there are escrowed donations to process and campaign has met its minimum amount

functions.name: process_escrowed_donations_batch
functions.doc:
* Process (aka move out of escrow) a batch of escrowed donations for a campaign
 * Can be called by anyone willing to pay the gas (max gas to avoid hitting gas limits)
 * Will return void without panicking if min_amount has not been reached

functions.name: transfer_funds_callback
functions.doc: Verifies whether donation & fees have been paid out for a given donation

functions.name: transfer_refund_callback
functions.doc: Verifies whether refund was successful and updates escrowed_donation_ids and Donation.returned accordingly for each donation refunded for this donor

AccountId.description:
NEAR Account Identifier.

This is a unique, syntactically valid, human-readable account identifier on the NEAR network.

[See the crate-level docs for information about validation.](index.html#account-id-rules)

Also see [Error kind precedence](AccountId#error-kind-precedence).

## Examples

``` use near_account_id::AccountId;

let alice: AccountId = "alice.near".parse().unwrap();

assert!("ƒelicia.near".parse::<AccountId>().is_err()); // (ƒ is not f) ```

Config.description: NOT stored in contract storage; only used for get_config response

ContractSourceMetadata.description: CONTRACT SOURCE METADATA - as per NEP 0330 (https://github.com/near/NEPs/blob/master/neps/nep-0330.md), with addition of `commit_hash`

commit_hash.description: Git commit hash of currently deployed contract code

link.description: GitHub repo url for currently deployed contract code

version.description: Version of source code, e.g. "v1.0.0", could correspond to Git tag

Donation.description: `Donation` is the data structure that is stored within the contract. *NB: recipient & ft_id are stored in the Campaign struct.*

donated_at_ms.description: Timestamp when the donation was made

net_amount.description: Net amount, after all fees & storage costs

returned_at_ms.description: Whether (and when) the donation was returned to sender

donated_at_ms.description: Timestamp when the donation was made

ft_id.description: FT ID (if None, it's a native NEAR donation)

is_in_escrow.description: Whether the donation is currently in escrow

net_amount.description: Net amount, after all fees & storage costs

recipient_id.description: ID of the account receiving the donation

returned_at_ms.description: Whether the donation was returned to sender

donated_at_ms.description: Timestamp when the donation was made

ft_id.description: FT ID (if None, it's a native NEAR donation)

is_in_escrow.description: Whether the donation is currently in escrow

net_amount.description: Net amount, after all fees & storage costs

recipient_id.description: ID of the account receiving the donation

returned_at_ms.description: Whether the donation was returned to sender

TempRefundRecord.description: Temporary record for refunding donations in batches. Includes an amount which may represent many donations.
